snippet: Todd Graff’s new film, “Joyful Noise,” turns his recollections of a Hadassah choir rehearsing in Queens into a church choir rollicking in Georgia.
abstract: Todd Graff hopes his new film Joyful Noise, about a church choir in Georgia, helps to revive the sagging musical genre that has marked his directing career.
lead_paragraph: Todd Graff’s new film, “Joyful Noise,” turns his recollections of a Hadassah choir rehearsing in Queens into a church choir rollicking in Georgia.

headline.seo: Todd Graff Sticks to His Favorite Genre in ‘Joyful Noise’
headline.main: Gleeful Sounds From Memories of Childhood
headline.print_headline: Gleeful Sounds From Memories Of Childhood
